results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, including a Design Through Matchmaking approach and a mixed-methods approach (qualitative interviews and quantitative SUS scores).
Sections 3.1-3.4 provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including the learning context, data collection, dashboard design, and user study.
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available. It mentions a link to a supplementary material for the interview protocol, but not the data itself.
Since the data is not made available, justification is not relevant.
Table 1 serves as a codebook explaining the spatial pedagogy behaviours observed. The document also describes the data collected (indoor positioning, voice activity, observations).
Data collection methods are fully described in section 3.2 and 3.4, detailing the sensors used, observation procedures, and interview process.
The document provides a GitHub repository link for TeamTeachingViz: 'https://github.com/riordanalfredo/TeamTeachingViz'.
The code is shared, so justification is not relevant.
The document mentions the use of py-WebtcVAD and provides links to relevant GitHub repositories, implying code for data preparation (e.g., voice activity detection).
The document describes the use of Cohen’s Kappa to assess inter-rater reliability and the calculation of SUS scores.
The SUS average score and standard deviation are reported (70.56 ±13.45).
The document provides rich, descriptive quotes from the interviews, demonstrating subjective context and interpretation of the data.
The document describes the use of deductive-inductive analysis for the interview data, including the coding process and theme identification.
The results are clearly presented in section 4, organized by research question, with thematic analysis and supporting quotes.
Section 5.3 explicitly discusses limitations of the study, including the small sample size for interviews and the generalizability of findings.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration on platforms like the Open Science Foundation.
